snippet.textDisplay: 8K yea the only thing 8K will be the display output but it will render at far less than that. 8K is only a marketing term to make it look good on the spec sheet. There are no graphics chips out yet that will run at even close to decent FPS at 8K. Heck even 4K is out of reach of almost all graphics chips except for the top end ones and even then the FPS is not all that high. so I laugh at their 8K claims..lol

snippet.textDisplay: I'm thinking the 8K will be for very simple (maybe even 2D) games, but most likely it means 8K streaming.  They also could use an up-scaled 4K or 6K native image to 8K output.  Won't look as good as native 8K, but still would look better than standard 4K.  120fps will probably be for 1080p native or maybe 1440p native with upscale to 4K output... that's just my guess.  Bottom line is that both the Xbox Next/Infinite/Omni and the PS5 will be basically the same hardware wise (which is good for game development) and no matter which you get you will be blown away with both, I'm sure.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm thinking the 8K will be for very simple (maybe even 2D) games, but most likely it means 8K streaming.  They also could use an up-scaled 4K or 6K native image to 8K output.  Won't look as good as native 8K, but still would look better than standard 4K.  120fps will probably be for 1080p native or maybe 1440p native with upscale to 4K output... that's just my guess.  Bottom line is that both the Xbox Next/Infinite/Omni and the PS5 will be basically the same hardware wise (which is good for game development) and no matter which you get you will be blown away with both, I'm sure.

snippet.textDisplay: Simple. Most games will target 4K 60. Some competitive titles will run 4K 60+. There will be high framerate/hz options for certain titles (backwards compat/competitive titles) for 1080p and 1440p since Xbox acknowledges that resolution (thank god) and it's going to be a much more interesting console generation (power-wise!) than last gen. 8K would've been for 8K video... but yeah, like said in this video.
snippet.textOriginal: Simple. Most games will target 4K 60. Some competitive titles will run 4K 60+. There will be high framerate/hz options for certain titles (backwards compat/competitive titles) for 1080p and 1440p since Xbox acknowledges that resolution (thank god) and it's going to be a much more interesting console generation (power-wise!) than last gen. 8K would've been for 8K video... but yeah, like said in this video.

snippet.textDisplay: Current '4k' consoles upscale from 1440p.  I suspect what will happen is that the next gen console will actually render near or up to 4k and then upscale from there.  If you look at the upcoming Navi graphics chips AMD are due to release soon they look to be good 1440p cards for PC.  With the increased efficiency of console platforms (largely due to having a very limited variation in hardware spec) that could translate to them acting as a basic 4k gpu.
snippet.textOriginal: Current '4k' consoles upscale from 1440p.  I suspect what will happen is that the next gen console will actually render near or up to 4k and then upscale from there.  If you look at the upcoming Navi graphics chips AMD are due to release soon they look to be good 1440p cards for PC.  With the increased efficiency of console platforms (largely due to having a very limited variation in hardware spec) that could translate to them acting as a basic 4k gpu.

snippet.textDisplay:
You're not the only one who's doubting what they are saying. If I still played on console I would not want to be an early adopter of the gen console considering how many iterations of the xbox one they put out. 

I don't see them achieving the standards they mentioned for their next gen console either. What I think they are counting on is most people not being able to tell the difference in Frame rate consider moat TV'S that people will use are probably making out at 60Hz unless you have a higher quality TV.  As long as they can hit those specs mentioned on the console  they can't claim that they mislead consumers. But I seriously doubt you will be able to get 120 frames per second at 8k on a console at the same time.

snippet.textDisplay: Not knowing what and how Microsoft will do it doesn’t mean they cannot do it ! It only means you do not understand it, which is a shame. But there is time and certainly Microsoft does not lack resources. I think criticism if a company makes promises and doesn’t deliver is in order but right now it should be just a case of let’s wait and see and let them work. Both Sony and Microsoft promised much, MS even gave a delivery date. Be patient.
